problems.title: Rotate Array by 1 Position Right
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to rotate the array to the right by 1 position.
After rotation, the last element of the array moves to the first position and all other elements shift to the right by one place.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the array elements after rotating by 1 position to the right.

Explanation
For example, if the array is [1 2 3 4 5], after one right rotation it becomes [5 1 2 3 4].
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
Array elements may be negative or positive
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)
hintsList: Save the last element, shift elements to the right, place saved value at index 0.

problems.title: Rotate Array by 1 Position Left
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to rotate the array to the left by 1 position.
After rotation, the first element moves to the last position, and all other elements shift to the left by one place.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the array elements after rotating by 1 position to the left.

Explanation
For example, if the array is [1 2 3 4 5], after one left rotation it becomes [2 3 4 5 1].
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Array elements may be negative or positive
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)
hintsList: Store the first element, shift all elements left, and place stored value at the last index.

problems.title: Count Duplicates in an Array
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to count how many distinct elements in the array appear more than once (duplicates). Print the count of unique duplicate values.
For example, in the array [1 2 2 3 3 3 4], duplicates are {2, 3}. So the answer is 2.

Time Complexity
Use a hashing frequency method. It runs in O(N) time and uses O(N) extra space.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print a single integer representing the number of distinct duplicate elements.

Explanation Example
Input: 7
1 2 2 3 3 3 4
Duplicate elements are: 2, 3
Count = 2
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Expected time complexity: O(N)
hintsList: Use a hashmap or dictionary to store frequency of each element.
Count only elements having frequency greater than 1.

problems.title: Check if Array Contains Duplicate
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to check whether the array contains any duplicate value.
If any element appears more than once, print "YES". Otherwise print "NO".

Time Complexity
The optimal solution uses a hash set and runs in O(N) time with O(N) extra space.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print YES if duplicates exist, otherwise print NO.

Explanation Example
Input:
6
1 2 3 4 1 5
Output:
YES
Because the value 1 appears more than once.
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be negative or positive
Expected time complexity: O(N)
hintsList: Use a set to track visited elements.
Stop early when any element repeats.

problems.title: Find Pair with Given Sum (Brute Force)
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers and a target value K. Your task is to determine whether there exists a pair of elements in the array whose sum equals K using a brute-force approach.
If such a pair exists, print YES, otherwise print NO.

Brute Force Approach
Check all possible pairs using two nested loops and compare their sum with K.

Time Complexity
The brute force solution checks all pairs, resulting in O(N^2) time complexity.
Space Complexity is O(1).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains an integer K (target sum).

Output Format
Print YES if a valid pair exists, otherwise print NO.

Explanation Example
Input:
5
1 2 3 4 5
6
Possible pairs: (1,5), (2,4), etc. Pair (1,5) = 6 so output is YES.
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10000
Array values may be negative or positive
Expected time complexity: O(N^2)

starterCodes.code:
def findPair(arr, n, k):
    # TODO: Return YES if any pair sum equals k, else NO using brute force
    return "NO"

def solve():
    n = int(input())
    arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
    k = int(input())
    result = findPair(arr, n, k)
    print(result)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()
